content: Says what it does. Does what it says. No complaints.

A great companion app to the journaling method itself. Incredibly helpful with brief, informative articles and videos. I love that I can keep pictures of my journal pages formatted in a very intuitive way. The only thing I would change is having the option to be reminded when the tasks I've logged will disappear from the app so I can remember to transfer them to the journal. Otherwise, a perfect companion and totally worth the one time fee.

Without reminders, this app has been useless to me. My logs always expire before I remember to transfer them to my BuJo when I get home. 100% of my logs entered into this app have been deleted. It's yet another "task" I'm forced to add to my to-do list, instead of a simple notification.

I love the archiving function of this app, but it is so obnoxiously inflexible. The 350 page limit means you can't use thicker notebooks without messing up the "proper" format. I can't choose not to date entries, and even then it is so rigid that it actually throws errors if I choose the "wrong date" for my bujo's time period. That means I also can't keep multiple active volumes, which is absurd. And the indexing is so limiting, since I can only add pages to a single category. Come on, seriously

I love my analog version of the bullet journal. The application is a very good complement when as example you don't have your notebook with you and want to write some task and not. However, having in the main menu Articles, Guide and Store is a real lost of space. The vast majority of people will use 99% of the time the Reflection, the log and the Library. Looks like this items have been added as a filling instead of usefullness. Sum up, I really like this application but it's very easy to use something better with Google Apps.

I love that its a companion app, and not a replacement to the functions of your journal, coz current systems are an "either / or " option; you can't really use one without making the other redundant. Exceptionally handy when you have an idea/task in your head, but your journal isn't with you. And the option to keep photos of your entry is good when you're on the go and you want to look back.
keeps improving, keeps me right. excellent purchase.
I can't open the library
Like it very much! Only difficulty is blurry photos no matter what photo option you choose.

very nice. i don't like the idea of lossing information after a few days. wish it would on phone for permanent book records. apparently it's not that important to me...i find myself drawn to using it daily lol. the functionality is beautifully designed. thank you!
s'good
simple, not overcomplicated. perfect for when I'm away from my physical notebook.
It does what is intended.

This is really helpful! The fact that the logs disappear if not written down on paper adds a sense of urgency. Feedback: I'd love a reminder/notification that the logs are going to disappear soon, it would really help
The new update makes the app way better! Thanks dev team!
replyContent: Hi, with the newest update it's possible to select photos from your Gallery. Does this help? Also, it's possible to tap on photos in the app and then you can use pinch-to-zoom to zoom into photos.

content: 5 stars! Thanks a lot for zoom functionality!

I've encountered a couple of issues these days which are extremely frustrating: 1) I can't see the complete list of Collections, can't scroll down to the bottom although the Collection has already been logged. 2) Why can't 2 notebooks have the same month? I finished my previous one in the 1st week of October.. 3)There are some serious bugs when taking photos from various places of the app. 4) Automatic backup to GDrive would be useful. 5) Cosmetic suggestion - Cyrillic characters friendly font
replyContent: Thank you for downloading our app. Could you contact us at support@bulletjournal.com, so we can look into these issues?

content: This app would be great if I could take clear photos of my Bullet Journal. I opted for the better quality setting but they are so blurred that I can't read any letters. It's a fantastic idea but it needs refining, maybe an in build phone camera scanner app would help? Update: this problem was fixed, images are not blurry anymore. I appreciate that someone took the time to comment under my review, thanks.
replyContent: Hi, we fixed a problem with blurry photos affecting some Samsung devices. The newest release 2.0.2 should solve your problem. Please let us know, if it works for you now. Thanks.

content: The app is convenient but I would suggest following features to make it better: 1) Transfer of data to SD Card. 2) Automatic Backup to Google Drive. 3) Change of Page Orientation (Notebooks have Odd number pages on the right and even ones on the left) 4) Zoom, Crop and Upload from Gallery. Apart from these drawbacks it really serves it's purpose. :)
I recommend using this app to cultivate Shamata
It's ok. Not sure if it's just my phone, but when I try to take photos of pages, the camera won't focus properly.
replyContent: Hi, we noticed that on some devices the camera won't focus properly. We are still working on a solution for that. With the newest update it's possible to choose pictures from the gallery. Thank you for your patience.

content: An elegant app that values simplicity over everything. The simplicity makes this an acceptable companion to a journal, but needs some work. The lack of zoom on pages is really unfortunate. My handwriting is not great and I can hardly read the text without squinting. A little more complexity and a few more features like the ability to add multiple tags to a page would be super helpful.
replyContent: Hi Aaron, really appreciate your suggestion. We will consider it and improve our app in the new version. With the newest update, it is possible to use pinch-to-zoom to zoom on pages.

content: Such a great idea, but it SUPER restrictive. In books and journals, the odd pages are on the right side. In the app, odd pages are on the left. Any two-page spreads get screwed by by that, unless you want to screw up your page numbers. There is no way to change that. If I'm taking photos of older pages, there seems to be no way to back-date them in the metadata. When entering a new journal, you select a page count. There is a maximum for no apparent reason. Very light on instruction.

Really wish there was a way to delete reflections, as I hit the wrong date by accident sometimes. Also found a bug: When setting up reflection times the AM/PM indicator doesn't work. It always shows AM on the second reflection time even if I set that to PM, and no indicator shows up at all on any AM times.

I primarily tried out this app for the library feature and quicky found that you would be much better off using a scanning app and then tagging/storing your notebook and pages in Notion or Onenote. The lack of zoom & cropping features immediately hampers pictures, and the log feature is easily replicated (and bettered) with Google reminders. I hate to be negative, but they would need to really put in some polish to make this app worthwhile as the alternatives are simply more useful.

I like what's happening with the app so far, but where's the library function that apple users get? This is one major reason I wanted this app. The log is nice, but I NEED the library. Edit: Love it after the update. Thank you for the r reply and getting it done!
replyContent: Hi Chris, please check the latest update in the store ;) Among other things we have added a new library feature. We think you will like it. If you have further feedback, don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us (support@bulletjournal.com).

content: I wake up well before eight and work until four, a big part of what I wanted was the reminders. Seems good over all but not quite what I need.
I do not see the 2.0 version. Is it restricted in some area?

Good tool, still buggy. I got this app a while ago, but as updates have come through, the Reflection Reminders got a big where I can't set a PM reminder, only two AM reminders which isn't as helpful. I love the resources linked in the app, and the dedicated tracker is great for building the habit.

I haven't used this app for a while but I see that the new update is out for version 2 and I'm excited to try it. Everything looks great so far! I have an Android phone and I'm glad the other features are now all available here too.
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store. The library feature is now available on Android too. Thanks for your support and patience.

content: I really like bujo method and decide to buy the app, but it have SERIOUSLY bug that I decide to give 1 star review until you fix it. Blurred photo, like camera not do autofocus at all, all the taken picture cannot use.

I love this app as it really serve its purpose. I would highly recommend an improvement for the archive's camera feature. Since I'm using a B5 size notebook for my BuJo, I sometimes find it hard to take a clean picture. I either have a full page with hard to read writings or a detailed writing but cropped out page. For future updates, I think everyone would love it if you can add a crop feature. Or... if you can import pictures from the phone so that we can edit the pictures to make it cleaner

My thoughts are shared as suggestions to improve the app. 1. In Collection View - have access to edit titles of collections 2. Provide access to Library backup via desktop What I appreciate about this app is two-fold 1. the prompt to Reflect daily am and pm 2. the ability to sort collections to focus on priorities The app is a vast improvement over the previous Android version. And I look forward to the next iteration. I would have given any other app 3 stars. But, I've been a BuJo user for 3-years and this app is a long awaited celebration of the BuJo Method Book and a Ryder Caroll follower and all of the blogs and groups working together. If there is a place to contribute or collaborate, please call on me.

I love the library section, it's great that I can store photos of each page of my journal. In a future update I suggest changing the start/end date feature to have a day of the month as well. I finished a journal last night, caught up on taking pics and set the end date to June 2020. While scrolling through it this morning I noticed it put all my entries from June 2-19 into a separate, second journal with no way to move them back. Not too happy about that

I was expecting more flexibility especially given the $5 price tag. When selecting a collection, only a portion are available. I can't scroll down to select more (even though they exist). I have to rewrite collections constantly. Also the fact that two journals can't have the same month is extremely frustrating. I ended one of my journals in the middle in June, but cannot start the next journal until July because of this limitation. Honestly might delete because of this.
Has bugs, good luck getting help.
Having problems trying to back up the bullet journal/access the Library tab. It keeps freezing the app? Other than that, a great App to use with your bullet journal.

Zoom feature would be nice and to upload photos would be nice as sometimes I take a pic of my pages to organise later if I have not got my journal with me, I also use squid and want to import my screen shots of my pages into that, squid is currently my bullet Journal! But this would be the icing on the cake for organisation

I love the reminders and all the other features of this app, but the reflection reminders no longer make sound. There was a stock sound that the app used to make when it fired off the reminder but it hasn't done so in quite a while. I miss that :(

May 2020. I was a bit disappointed by the limited feature set, given the $5 price tag. You can't zoom images, the page number orientation (even = right, odd = left) can't be changed, and I'd like to use a single image to cover 2 pages at once. You also can't have 2 journals with overlapping dates or custom names. It works well enough, but it lacks the flexibility that I expect relating to bullet journals.

It needs a feature that let's you zoom in on the pictures you've taken. Being able to zoom on ALL the pictures within the app would be great because there is a lot of small print on sample pics, but zooming on the pictures you upload to your library would be amazing because many of us write small and you want to capture the full pic. Love that I can take pics and have a digital copy of my bujo. Just got it and haven't had a chance to use all of the features but it's what is advertised so far!

Nice companion app to my bullet journalling. Please fix the spelling error (the word 'pictures') in the example photo above. First impressions matter, and seeing this error made me cautious about spending $7.99 on the app. Which is actually very polished and useful.
I can't focus the camera! (I'm using pixel xl) If we can add photo from photo gallery. It will be great!

I love this app. For years, I have struggled between a digital management system versus a paper-based one. Both have their benefits. I've come to realise that it's not an either-or question, but both are necessary. This app helps to bridge the two worlds without trying to do too much. That is one of its key distinctions. The somewhat minimalist nature of this app is a feature, not a bug. Non-bujo practitioners will not understand this app and think that it's "useless." As its name says, it is a *companion* to your bullet journal, and if you are a bullet journal user, you will probably find it handy. It is also powerful. Using the Library feature, you can have a digital record of all the key entries in all your bujos. If you're particularly obsessive, you could even have a photographic record of all your bullet journal pages. I'm grateful that this app came out while I was on my first volume, so I can imagine that I'll be having a great paper-digital hybrid record of my journals from here on to the end of days. The only reason I didn't give this app a full 5 stars is because it doesn't allow overlapping of dates for volumes. For example, my first volume ended in the midst of April, so by right Vol 1 should end in Apr and Vol 2 should start in May. The app forces Vol 2 to start in May. This is clearly a design mistake. Other than that, I'm loving this app and bujo, and I expect that little bugs like that mentioned above will be ironed out in time.

I would appreciate if the capture function would be easier to handle. My BuJo is not a conventional size, and it's not clear when will the app stitch the two pages together properly. Either let me set the size of my pages or make a clearer marking where the spine is supposed to be?

Does what it says & updates have provided good features that I'm interested in. Worth the money as a companion to a physical bullet journal. Even before any updates, the log was just what I needed when I only had had my phone or just wanted to jot something quickly. I have mixed feelings about the log entries expiring after 72 hours, but as long as I transfer entries from the app when migrating tasks, I don't lose information often.

With the addition of the archive feature this is exactly what I was looking for in a companion app! The app itself is streamlined and well designed and includes helpful guides and a shortcut to the blog articles.
There should be an option to refund this app.
There is Glistch when accessing lib in Android version. App doesn't respond and collapses when I try to open one of my bujos. Please fix this, thank you.

This is a perfect companion for my Bullet Journal. The absolute minimalist approach works perfectly. The library feature enables me to have my notes with me even when my journal isn't. The developer was very helpful and quick to assist with a problem I've experienced. 2.0.2, fixes the focus problem. Thank you.
replyContent: Hi, 2.0.2 is out. This update fixes a problem regarding focussing properly on some Samsung devices (namely Samsung Galaxy S8 and Note8). It should now work for you too. Sorry, it took us some time to find a solution to this problem.

content: Since photos have been added to reflection I can't turn them off. I've gone to settings and toggled them off several times. Next time I used reflection they were on again. Please fix!
Set up new Journal and was able to add 2 pages to the library. Now unable to open the Library and the app crashes on every attempt.
Photos are small and can be hard to read. Can we have a zoom feature please ?

I love the library idea but my camera will not focus to enable clear photos to be captured. The update that supposedly fixed this problem has not fixed it at all. I've emailed the developer and am awaiting a response.
replyContent: Hello, please check out our newest release. We have fixed a problem regarding taking blurry photos. Thank you for your patience

content: The app is good but the library won't open for me. I can take pictures through the reflection page and view them there, but when I tap the Library in the main menu the app stops responding. Once this is fixed this will be a spectacular app.
replyContent: Hi Elizabeth, sorry that it took us a bit to be able to fix this problem. But with the newest update, you should be able to use the Library feature without problems. Thank you for your patience.

content: Updated thank you now it's perfect for me!!
replyContent: Hi Deborah, the library feature is now available. Please check the latest update in the store ;)

content: Great update, one more features would make it perfect and that is the ability to import pictures, instead of just capturing photos.

I have been using this for over a year to help take notes and log while I don't have my bujo with me, works great for that. I was excited about the recent update with the library finally coming to Andoid, but I don't have the ability to apply tags to notebooks which is a key reason for the library.
The app isn't bad nor is it great, this will be helpful to some but most will find this lacking.

Keep me motivated to journal with picture copy of my bullet journal pages, friendly reminder and quotes. I have my bullet journal always with me. So, I rarely use the log functionality, but I used it a lot in the past.
More features pls.

Great for noting ideas on the go. However, I have serperate journals for different areas of my life. Currently, these can't run concurrently, it would be great if you could make that a feature and we could change the titles of our journals.

This app is worth. I understand how Ryder made this as simple as possible so as to avoid distractions. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è But lately i encountered a problem when i needed to log something and that task required a Nesting of Subtask and Important Notes. üò≠üò≠üò≠ Is there anyway to maybe add a Nesting Feature for the Entries being added in the Log Section? üòäüòäüòä Thank You very much in advance for the response.

The most recent update has broken the reflection function for my use. I don't want to take photos of my journal, I just want a daily reminder with the satisfying "X" when I've done it twice in one day. The new update doesn't seem to allow you to mark a reflection without taking a photo.
replyContent: Hi, thanks for sharing your feedback. In the newest release, we made taking photos while reflecting optional. Now there is a setting in the app to configure if you want to take photos or not when reflecting.

content: Thank you, thank you, thank you! We finally get to log our notebook library on the Android app! The app in now perfect, and about time! However, one thing I noticed is that you always have to assign a date to a Library page, this doesn't really work for collections that don't have happen on a particular day like the Future Log. If this can be fixed it would be even better.

LOVE latest updates to the Android app! One suggestion: Since we are unable to use the same dates when logging our BuJos in the Library, you should change the date settings to allow for Day/Month/Year instead of just Month/Year. Rsn: it is possible to end and start a BuJo in the same month, but the app doesn't allow for that. Thank you!
New update has Library support! I a great companion to my bullet journal.

A great digital companion for an analog tool. I usually have my bullet journal with me, but I'm glad to have a temporary log in this app for those tasks or notes I want to capture on occasion when my notebook isn't handy. Combined with the reflection reminders, this app's log is a handy way to avoid going overboard trying to digitalie my BuJo. I do wish I could go back and log reflections after the fact and there needs to be a way to turn off sounds.
Very useful, but I want it to have a widget. Please add this feature! Like a little mini note widget for my home pages on my phone.
If it had library function would give 5 stars.
replyContent: Hi Rod, we just released a new update containing a new library feature. You might want to check this out. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Could use some new quotes. These ones haven't changed in ages!!

Really like the idea of beeing able to take notes on your phone and then getting that motivational factor to actually transfer it to your journal but there are a number of things that I would personally want to change. First of all it would be nice to be able to choose the backgroundpicture yourself. Secondly I would like the option to hide the guide once you have read it. Third and finally I don't like the article feature I don't think it aligns with the app as a tool, more a distraction.
Main feature is missing compared to the iPhone app: Tagging and scanning old notebooks. Please add this feature to the Android app too!
replyContent: Hi Marco, please check the latest update in the store ;) There is a new library feature, which should be exactly what you need. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Has helped me get back into my bullet journal immensely

I'm new to bullet journaling the book is a lot more than what I've seen online (fancy art, habit tracking) I started journaling one way without the book and now with the book am realizing how much I've complicated it. The method is simple enough but simple us not easy it's pieces to learn and move forward on. Reflection is very useful, action is key. This app looks quite simple and is anything but, it allows time to think about what's important in my life and move toward, not quite there yet.
It's good. I'd like to be able to zoom in on the pictures though.

It's a good companion to using a BUJO, but the Android version is missing a feature that's available in the iPhone. Library is missing, which allows you to catalog your journals and their indexes and collections. It's been on the iPhone for a couple years, but not in Android. When will we get that feature?
replyContent: Hi Bret, please check the latest update in the store ;) The new library feature is finally also available in the Android app. Thank you for your patience.

content: For reflection reminders can you allow them in a 24 hour format, I work over nights and so my start of day is about 9pm, end of day 9am in its current format I cannot set these reminders practically.

Hi Ryder.. I know you're quite busy with your works but just a lil reminder if you've forgotten..that to implement the Library section in the Android version of this app..cause now that I've known the system so well..i really need that interbook threading...and the Library section will be very very helpful. Please do introduce that as it's almost 1 year of release of the Android app and still there's no update. Kindly work on that cause we are patiently waiting for it‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store ;) There is a new library feature, which should be exactly what you need. Thank you for your feedback (and your patience).

content: Excellent overview of the BuJo method and little else.
replyContent: Hi, thank your for the feedback. You might want to check out the latest release as we have added a lot of new features.

content: App is mising features from iOS version, and does not have syncing.
replyContent: Hi David, please check the latest update in the store ;) There is a new library feature, which should be exactly what you need.

content: Doesnt do anything useful? Just a 3$ reminder app where you cant even store your journal pages.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear that the app is not what you were expecting. You might want to check out the latest release. We have added a lot of new features you might find useful.

content: The Bullet journal has changed my life and how I think about what is important. The app is clean and simple and does just what it is supposed to do. Even if I never used the app paying the few dollars for the app just to say thank you for the creator of the Bullet Journal for sharing the method is OK with me.

Are there any plans to update this app with some of the recommendations in the reviews?  Specifically, I‚Äôd like to see a way to access archived tasks and a warning before a task expires.  An ability to either change the 72 hours or snooze an item would be beneficial too! I'll update my review once those are addressed.

Would be 4 stars but developers should add a notification feature so notes don't disappear without warning the user. Totally get the minimalist-clean-interface thing, but no notification before deletion? Dealbreaker.
its quite useful and eyecandy, but a good log widget is lacking!
Great Bujo companion.

I was uneasy spending $ on this app because I wasnt sure I was going to stick with bujo and the mixed reviews sounded like the app didn't do much. I am happy to report the app is fantastic and was the missing piece in my bujo workflow! I LOVE being able to capture ideas and know that they will be in my paper bujo within 72 hrs or they disappear... I love the beautiful, peaceful user interface. This app has been reliable, simple to use, and has helped me fully embrace bullet journaling. Get it!
I like it but I was expecting the library function :/
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store. We have added the library function.

content: Beautiful and aesthetic app, but not much to do on it and definitely not worth spending money on.
replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. Please check the latest update in the store ;) We have added a new library feature which might be useful to you.

content: The Bullet Journal¬© Is an amazing system that has helped me reorganize my life. I have tried many work setups, but this one fits best. Fully customizable, and amazing for my fellow ADD/ADHD peeps.

Must have companion app for ADD user of Journal. I realized I left my journal at work and almost freaked at the thought of recording into another journal for the weekend. I just got a system that works!!! so I downloaded the app and was immediately wowed. Not only do I now have a way to record my thoughts, but I'm forced to transfer them or they will disappear. That's motivation I need. Then I found articles on things I would never have thought to look for. Super useful. Clean app interface.
it's great as far as it goes but not what I was expecting from a paid app. I don't seem to have a refund option even having uninstalled though. how do I get a refund?!
useless just open any other note app and is more complete

I support Bullet Journal, because it's flexible and can be endlessly adapted by the user. In contrast, this Android app is hamstrung, stiff and counterintuitive. That's surprising for an app that costs money, but the quirks would be frustrating even in a free app. The Log with its time limitations and deletions is odd but serves a purpose. However, the operating principles behind Reflections are completely inexplicable and quirky. It looks good but it's a clunker... a rough draft.

Like everyone else, I bought it for the Library function discussed in Ryder's videos. Until they put that in, it should be free or at least be clear that function is not included. I was fas enough to get a refund.
helpful. waiting on the library feature!
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store ;) The library feature is now available. Thank you for your patience.

content: Not enough warning before it erases all my notes. Notifications don't work.

As an ADD, I have to say this guy gets it. When Ryder Carroll and his team developed companion app, they really meant companion app and nothing more. Your main tool is still your physical notebook. There are contradicting reviews and you might be wondering which one to trust. My advice is to look into the philosophy behind Bullet Journal. For this, I recommend watching Carroll's Ted talk. If you agree his idea and need extra help for maintaining habit, get this app. Otherwise, don't.
Works like a charm as a Bullet Journal companion. All the negative reviews are just asking for a full replacement of the Bullet Journal, and this app was never intended for that.

The notifications aren't working properly for the Review Function. For a pretty bare-bones app, this makes it fairly useless.  Overall I like the idea of it being a companion to an actual journal, with the time limits on the Log and so on, but with this being broken the app is currently a waste of money.

Does the job, but just okay.  I LIKE the rapid logging that expires after 72hrs..forces you to commit to the log.  I LIKE the Articles and Guide are handy, but essentially same content available online. The functionality I need IS THE AVAILABLE IN THE IOS APP ONLY  :-(,  and that is the ability to capture the Table of Contents and Collections/Projects from previous journals. THIS SHOULD BE A TOP PRIORITY TO ALIGN FUNCTIONALITY ACROSS PLATFORMS.   The Reflection function is a great idea but I would like the ability to turn off the notifications. I don't want distractions of the reminders multiple times per day.

Disappointed with this app. The book promised a library functionality which isn't there and the other features don't work brilliantly. Sometimes I do the reflection but forget to mark it off in the app. After a while I can no longer mark off that reflection so I'm left with a gap in the diary which really annoys me. Why can't I retrospectively mark off a reflection. Wish I could get a refund but too late now.
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store. We have added the library feature. Thank you for your feedback.

content: Great app. Really useful. I like the functionality. Perfect counterpart to my BuJo.
good suppliment to a bullet journal.

works very well. Simple and help a lot as a companion to my bullet journal. Great for quick notes and thoughts on the go, and then reconciliated into my bullet journal later on in the day. Missing some of the features from the iphone app, but the core function is here.
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store. We have added the Library feature.

content: bought mostly to support ryder. app is a good idea but is VERY basic

A brilliant simple concept for a companion app. It really supports the use of a paper journal. Rapid logging events expire after 72hours initially put me off but I now realise is the apps genius. It is a bucket to collect incoming thoughts and feed them through to your bujo. This stops it being another long term store for stuff I havent thought about. Huge thank you to Ryder

I'm happy enough to send the the author a few bux since I love the system so much, but honestly this app is not very useful beyond providing a portal to the website. Might check out again in the future if anything is added but for now it's being removed.
Great app: does exactly what it promises and exactly what it should! This is not an electronic bullet journal - it is a companion and not meant to replace the paper journal. Great!

Disappointing, not worth paying for! nothing too this app at all. It is not a companion. No response from support, or Ryder. There needs to be more to this app and notes should not get erased after 72 hours.

Does the job, but not well. The entire app is essentially just content freely available on the website, plus a temporary rapid log that expires entries after 72 hours. NOT worth the money unless you have free google play credit lying around like I did. The Reflection function is a great idea but again not worth paying for, its just two alarms per day, you can set the times but the interface could be a lot better, and the scheduling should be freer - one a day would suit me better

This is a start, but the current version feels anemic. I get that the creator probably wants to keep a minimalist approach, but if I'm to pay for an app, I'd expect more features from it than a few links I can find in my phone's browser, and a reminder function.  My main problem with the app is that there is no way to sync your notes to different devices. I have a personal phone, a work phone, a tablet, and a chromebook that runs android apps -- and I am NOT going to check every device at the end of the day to make sure I didn't miss any notes.  Please, please, please support multi-device sync!  I would also love if this had a habit tracker feature. I love habit trackers, but I do not like the tedium of making them every month. I think it would compliment the bullet journal beautifully.  Overall I think it's a good idea because I love bullet journaling and sometimes the method can use some digital help, but I think it still needs further development.

As a companion to a bullet journal this app is perfect. I wish I had this app when I started a year ago. Reflection is an important part of bullet journaling and i really wasn't taking time to do that. This app really encourages you to make it a habit. The logging feature is really nice too. If you're away from your notebook you can log some tasks temporarily in the app. Next time you reflect it will prompt you to enter them in your journal.

I bought this app mostly for the Library section that is on the iOS app, but once again Android users are left behind. It has been over a year since it was launched in iOS and you don't have it here yet? Thank u, next.

i enjoy the app. i wish i can set up a monthly overview with different times for reflection. As the app is now i can only do a weekly which stays the same throughout the month ( great for a 9 to 5 job) as it is now i keep missing my reflection time mostly because of my retail work schedule

Holy Cow! I was hesitant about paying for this app, but I love it. Having my bullet journal with me at all times is impossible. However, I don't go anywhere without my phone and the reflections reminder part is awesome. The rest is icing on the cake. :)
Thank you for finally changing the background, it was very disturbing. That said, great app, I use it every day.

Does exactly what it said it would, nice and minimalist. To those having problems with notifications not occurring, make sure a battery saver app such as the one built into Samsung Galaxy Phones isn't killing the app. Add this app to unmonitored or "allow to always run".

The library will be a significant add, once they push it out. Too bad they couldn't have made it available to Android users from the start. I'll have to rate again after that feature is added, but for now the basic functionality is ok.
replyContent: Hi, please check the latest update in the store.  We have now added the library feature.

content: Simply don't like it

I bought this app for the library function to work in tandem with the official bullet journal only to discover that there is no library function. I am very unhappy with this purchase and recommend looking elsewhere if you want to recored your bullet journal.
Not intuitive at all
Too simple...

It's nice if you don't know what you are doing and need structure. It is not good if you want a digital buju, this app only saves things for 72 hours and there is no way to archive anything. It is kinda like one of those how to articles that is a giant ad for the product. BUT.... it is very pretty, calming, the text is kind to my eyes. It is well designed, but maybe not well utilized.  I will keep it in hopes of an archive!
Good app overall but I wish the log would stay open and there was a widget. Much for useful than other Todo apps because it follows the same systems as my other planners.

Having timed notes and reflection reminders built into one app is brilliant, but it doesn't work! I have only gotten the notification once, and I haven't been able to figure out what circumstances were necessary for that one lucky moment. I have no problems getting notifications from any other app, and I made sure my settings for it are all the same. No response from support at all, and of course I forgot about it since the reminders don't work so it's too late for a refund. Money down the drain!

I'm pretty happy with it. But there's a couple of things I wish it had. A) The library feature, I think a few people have already mentioned that. B) A way to look at the quotes for the day or past quotes. Really love those quotes, they're great ones.
I love the look of this app and eagerly awaited it for Androidbutit does not contain the "Library function yet which was the main appeal. If it had the "Library" function, I'd give 5 stars.

So happy upon android version of this app . I have been eagerly waiting upon the bullet journal system method's arrival on our smartphones . The content is very limited though it would b nice 2 have more control over this app certainly tracking everyday life
I don't like the overall app and features
I'm happy the andrioid version is here. Thank you for making it available. (Hopefully, the library section wil be available soon).

I have been eagerly awaiting this app and purchased it immediately. But the app has limited functionality and repeated emails to customer service have resulted in zero response. I'll upgrade my rating as soon as the app works.
Useful articles. Would be helpful if had greater control over the reminders, like only one a day to give flexibility. Bulley journalling is after all flexible in what you do and how.

A month in and I've found some use in the transient Log, but functionality seems to be falling off with the loss of articles rather than improving with widgets or integrations. Seems a shell for the web page rather than an improvement justifying any cost. -2018.09.12 SG. This is not a "digital bullet journal" app, to replace the hardcopy. It is exactly a companion app. While the current market has gotten us used to "free" apps (ad supported), the cost of $3 seems reasonable for an ad-free, simple utility. --- An apparent presentation of the website with a bit more additional functionality in the 72hr log. It is a very pretty, though specific in presentation without a way to update backgrounds or modify the launch page. Some of the Log functionality is intuitive and clever (shifting a task to note, pushed, or completed) and it some functions are missing (correcting a push to a task if it was mistakenly updated rather than deleting and reentering). --- It seems like aspects are not yet implemented (KB and Newsletter links go to the website rather than being integrated in the app). I'd also like to see a way to set up multiple Logs to support my split between home/work, as well as a widget to put the Log on a desktop to keep leading items in field of view. --- The 3-star review is an initial impressions value from the large pull of data from the web, I'll likely update in about a week. It seems a good start. -2018.08.16 SG
Upon latest update, I can't access the articles section as it won't load anymore. Any solution?
Articles were available at first; however now they are not. It is now a glorified alarm clock. Ridiculous. I want my money back.
App works pretty well. The article section won't load on my phone though, which is disappointing.
Really disappointed. No updates in a month and app has basically no features. I will continue to wait but unistalling is really tempting...
I think the log is confusing, Why can i only choose between an X and a < symbol but not the other > literally any other note app works better!

I love the app overall. My only complaint is that the reflection pm reminder won't work. It will only allow am reminders for some reason. I'm using a pixel 2. I got it to work for a short time by uninstalling and reinstalling the app. Hope an update to either the app or my phone fixes the issue soon.
The guide is good to have. I set up the reflection alerts to 08:30 and 20:30. I live in London and the alerts are popping up according to Eastern Standard time in the US.
Great app for what it needs to do, only thing is that on my device the articles won't load.
Great guide. Would appreciate a mute button on the reflection strike-through
I really like this app being a bullet journal newbie however I would like to see some inspirational content for doodling. I would submit 5‚≠êrating with that.

This app is definitely basic, and incomplete as I know your plans are to build on the other features eventually. Knowing that, I love the app and the way it functions! The articles are helpful and intriguing, the guide helps when I'm switching notebooks, and the log lets me keep track of tasks while my notebook is away. Beautifully designed.

The app is pretty great! The only thing that bugs me is that we can't decide to activate only one reminder and we can't have both of them in am or pm. Personally i have a weird schedule and this is a bit annoying. Otherwise the app is great! The log system is genius! (...But if there could be a subtle line to separate the different days in witch things were logged it would be nice!)

I've been waiting for Android version for a long time and now it is finally here! Still many functions to be implemented, but I'm sure they'll be available soon! Looking forward to new features and wishing authors to keep up the great work!

A welcome addition to my system. Certainly has helped develop my BuJo into a habit with the Reflection notifications. The links in the articles do not seem to be working and don't take me to the specific landing page. Thumbs up for sure though! :)
Been waiting for the Android version! Yay!

The visual design looks awesome and feels smooth. Absolutely LOVE the Log 
feature. It means I have a place to capture things on the go until I get a 
second to transfer it into my actual Journal.

Helpful addition to my Bullet Journal system. Simple and easy to quickly 
jot down notes and tasks, especially when combined with my voice to text 
keyboard. My incoming Tasks had been getting lost in my overburdened 
Evernote inbox and now they have a place of their own. That has been 
working out well for me the past few days, since I installed the app. I've 
also reduced my reliance on sticky notes. I find the reflection reminders 
helpful too.

The people giving one star single sentence reviews are clearly not 
understanding what this app is intended for. It's not a digital bujo but a 
supplement to your existing physical bujo. That being the case, it has 
definitely helped keep me on track with the daily reflection. Very small 
nitpick but the area where you set your two times for reflections does not 
let me set a time for around the midnight-1am hours. I was able to work 
around it by setting my evening hour as the morning one. Maybe allow both 
times to choose from a 24 hour time window? I was also looking for the 
library function but that seems to already be in the timeline ahead so I 
can wait.

I think there's a fundamental misunderstanding about what this app is supposed to do.  It perfectly complements the  whole experience.  The app reminds you of the Reflection time which is when you take the time to review your journal usually in the morning and at night.   To me that's a really useful feature because I used to constantly forget to do it daily.  The log is the best feature in my opinion.  I don't work in an office or a place where I can have access to my journal throughout the day except on my breaks.  This helps immensely  because now I don't have to worry about writing it somewhere else and forgetting.  Unfortunately it doesn't have a way to prevent me from losing it.  (I already lost one :( )  So until they create a notebook with an NFC tag on the cover that will pair with your phone using BLE  that notifies you when you stray too far from it. *Hint*   I'll take the next best thing; a system and an app that will help organize your life in a way that's efficient, intuitive and fluid.  Bullet Journal has helped me immensely and I can¬¥t help but be excited about new features to come.  Thank you.

- Beautiful app, love the flow  - Log is perfect, thank you  * Put an "up" button into views. It's not immediately obvious Back button goes to previous activity  - Playdays should toggle after setting Workdays reminders for the first time   * Fix typo on Article intro: "from the our blog"  - Looking forward to having this companion

I bought this app to support Ryder, Looking forward to the feature updates, 
there are plenty of potential, and hopefully it can turn to a digital bujo, 
don't get me wrong, i love oen and paper but i cant carry it with me all 
the time and digitally task management is faster.

despite the lack of..everything that needed. I just buy the app to support. 
Hope that everything will go right as planned.

Just "Reflections", that is reminding on weekdays (split between "workdays" 
and "playdays") at preset times (one @AM & one @PM) to check BuJo and 
"Log", that is a place for notes of type ‚Ä¢/‚Äì/o that will disappear after 
72h unless deleted. The rest is just Guide&Articles otherwise available on 
the website. I see it more as a donation and not exactly a real purchase, 
given the fact that 13z≈Ç is definitely not just some spare change for me. 
There should be an option added to append each note added, with a date, to 
a text file on sdcard. That way stuff noted in the app could be safe should 
one lose one's phone and then find it after 60-80h or more.

This is a beautifully designed companion app to the Bullet Journal method. 
It's simple, elegant, and exactly what is promised. I am looking forward to 
using this app to enhance my journaling experience.

This app is simple and solid. It is a great place to take quick notes while 
my Bullet Journal is out of reach. I would really like the ability to 
re-order my log entries, but that's the only real problem I have with the 
app.

I must say I was very disappointed in the app after I spent $2.99 to 
purchase it. I basically just paid $3 for information that I had already 
read and gotten from the bullet Journal website and from the book I spent 
20 something dollars on. I don't know what the Apple app includes but some 
of the reviews here lead me to believe that it's way more Interactive. I 
didn't need to pay $3 to be able to set up reminders to check my BUJO daily 
as I have an app for that it is called a clock. Also if I'm going to take 
the time to enter task etc for 72 hours I would like it too stay there for 
longer but I can actually do this on my own by simply sending myself a text 
message with the appropriate symbols. I guess really when I went into this 
I had no idea of what I expected but after the long wait for such an app to 
even exist and then to be made available for Android I would have been more 
than happy to wait the additional time that it takes for this app to have 
the updates to it that have been annotated in this comment thread to be 
included in the original. It's very disheartening to purchase something 
only to be told oh we're creating an update that is going to be sent out 
later this year I don't believe I read it but why wasn't that included in 
the information about the app prior to purchase. Sorry guys thumbs down on 
this one. I hope this promised update is worth the wait cuz as of right now 
I'm not feeling it. I wasn't able to find exact statistics on Android users 
versus iPhone users and the one that I did find seemed a bit biased but I'm 
not sure... it had Android users at 51% versus iPhone users at 49%. 
Regardless of the validity of the statistical information you can look at 
iPhone sales versus Android sales of smartphones and see that the Android 
market is just as viable as the iPhone market. So my question is is why do 
people keep pushing out these apps to iPhone first totally negating the 
Android User population.? I would think they would be equally important 
because think of all of the sales of the app that you missed out on because 
of the lack of an Android app. And now that there is one it's not 
sufficient in comparison to the already year Plus available iPhone app. 
Also with the large Market that the bullet Journal phenomenon has created 
there's already significant viable competition of other bullet Journal apps 
available. I've read articles where people have given up on waiting for an 
Android app from this company and gone ahead and moved on to something else 
as a result. I can guarantee that this app is not anything to make them 
come back anytime soon. Again I'll wait and see what the update has to 
offer. I've already spent my $3 and invested my time. I just hope 
ultimately it's worth the wait.

I don't have any of the navigation problems other reviewers are posting. I 
have a Pixel and the lower navigation bar is always present and the back 
button is all I need to navigate through the app, and the home button to 
close it. I appreciate having all the BuJo concepts one centralized 
resource. It's well worth the $3 (less than a cup of Starbucks) to support 
Ryder and all the hard work the developers put into making this app a 
reality. That being said, this is a V1 release, so of course there's room 
for improvement and more functionality, so I can't wait to see what's 
happening next.

This is exactly what the videos on the Bujo website said it would be. I'm 
very glad you were able too finally make an Android app. Only piece that 
seems to be missing from the iPhone version is the "library." That's the 
next piece I would like to see and the reason I didn't give it 5 stars. 
It's very clear this app is not meant to replace your journal. I expect it 
to grow in functionality as promised.
replyContent: Thank you for your constructive feedback. Yes, we're actively working on the Library feature for Android. It will be a free update when it's ready a little later this year. Our goal was to get the most critical features to our many Android users first, and then build on them.

content:
Too bad that the library feature is not available in the Android version, 
specially as it has been part of the iPhone version for over a year now.
replyContent: We are actively developing this, and it will be a free update later this year.

content:
This app should definitely have been free and not $2.99 due to the lack of 
features and functionality. There's no easy way to go back( swiping right 
or left would be good here), the content is very minimal, and there's 
really nothing I didn't already know about bullet journaling in here. I 
absolutely love bullet journaling and I'm now in my second year. I'm hoping 
to see improvements in this app over time.

After initial setup, would be helpful to be able to set a custom sratpage 
and utilize the material design aspects for navigation. Hook into the 
calender for reminders. So much potential.
